Bhawna Dixit
Protein molecular modeling & structural bioinformatics
About me

Exploring gradations in protein dynamics.

I am a PhD scientist working at the interface of protein molecular modeling, structural bioinformatics and biophysical prediction. My research combines molecular dynamics simulations, NMR ensembles, AlphaFold2 models and large-scale normal mode analysis to understand how gradations in protein flexibility shape function and interpretation.

Gradations in protein dynamics (AF–NMR–NMA) α-1 acid glycoprotein (AGP) dynamics in cancer Protein biophysical feature prediction Molecular dynamics & ensemble analysis
ORCID: 0000-0003-4718-4911 GitHub: github.com/Bhawnadixit Bio2Byte: profile & projects

Proteins

Gradations & AGP – core protein work

The two main threads of my PhD are (1) a proteome-scale view of how different metrics capture protein flexibility, and (2) a detailed case study of α-1 acid glycoprotein (AGP) in cancer using molecular dynamics.

Gradations in protein dynamics – AF–NMR–NMA
Journal of Molecular Biology (2025) · Gradations in protein dynamics
Across hundreds of proteins with NMR ensembles, AlphaFold2 models and normal mode analyses, we show that flexible regions form a continuum of behaviors that is only partially captured by pLDDT and other computational metrics. Rigid regions are robustly identified, but experimentally observed gradations in dynamics are often compressed into simplified “disordered” or “ordered” categories. The AF–NMR–NMA resource exposes these gradations per protein and serves as a benchmark for new AI approaches to protein flexibility.

View AF–NMR–NMA interactive site ↗
AGP conformational dynamics in cancer
PROTEINS (2024) · Glycosylation, mutations & multi-replica MD
For α-1 acid glycoprotein I constructed glycosylated and unglycosylated systems with cancer-associated mutations, and ran multi-replica molecular dynamics to quantify how glycosylation and mutation reshape backbone flexibility and glycan conformations. The work shows that glycosylation can locally decrease flexibility while redistributing motion, and that mutations close to glycosylation sites re-pattern both glycan dynamics and ligand-accessible surface.

Animated summary slide of AGP simulations: three replicas for four systems (AGP, gly-AGP, R101W, gly-R101W) arranged along a flexibility axis. Export your PowerPoint slide as a GIF and save it as assets/agp_dynamics_slide.gif to display it here.

Projects

GitHub projects & computational tooling

Most of my code is hosted on GitHub under github.com/Bhawnadixit . Below are the main project themes; the full list of repositories is available on my profile.

  • Gradations of protein dynamics – analysis pipelines
    Analysis notebooks and scripts for processing NMR ensembles, AlphaFold2 models and normal mode analyses; computing correlations between experimental and predicted dynamics; generating residue-wise gradation profiles; and preparing figures and data for the JMB paper and AF–NMR–NMA web resource.
  • AGP molecular dynamics & glycosylation
    Workflows for building glycosylated and unglycosylated AGP systems, running multi-replica MD simulations, and quantifying backbone RMSF, glycan sampling and flexibility redistribution across mutations relevant to cancer.
  • Protein biophysics tooling & notebooks
    Utilities for working with b2bTools predictions and related biophysical features, combining sequence-based predictors with structural models, and exploring relationships between predicted disorder/dynamics and experimental ensembles.
  • Additional experiments & prototype models
    Smaller repositories and prototypes connected to my thesis work, including tests around ensemble correlations, neural-network approaches for flexibility prediction and exploratory notebooks for new datasets.

For the complete and always current list of repositories, visit my GitHub profile ↗ .
